quote: I was already fatigued, disheartened, supremely worried I couldn't tackle this race, and honestly a mental half step away from tears of frustration... A hug from my coach and friend... with reassurance that he was in the same situation gave me hope.
Day 1: 225 miles in 15hrs 34min, Normalized Power(149 watts)... My heart rate had been markedly higher than anticipated all day. I'd done this climb before and performed much better...

The highlight of the day was Burma Road. It was a lovely gravel road following the Big Hole River. The views were superb. A herd of bighorn sheep were grazing in an irrigated field. It was rocky, hilly perfection and just what I needed.
Nervous or worried? Don't hesitate to reach out. We're happy to answer as many questions as needed to make you feel comfortable on the starting line!
I did use an Ice Friction chain. It was my first experience and superb. The chain was flawless and smooth the entire race.
I used all apparel and gear except my tent. I used no repair tools thanks to the careful inspection and care from Kyle's Bikes.
